checkrule_set.rule_title: Arrays do not override equals() or hashCode, so comparisons will be done on reference equality only. If neither deduplication nor lookup are needed, consider using a List instead. Otherwise, use IdentityHashMap/Set, a Map from a library that handles object arrays, or an Iterable/List of pairs.
checkrule_set.description: Arrays do not override equals() or hashCode, so comparisons will be done on reference equality only. If neither deduplication nor lookup are needed, consider using a List instead. Otherwise, use IdentityHashMap/Set, a Map from a library that handles object arrays, or an Iterable/List of pairs.

checkrule_set.description: Arguments are swapped in assertEquals-like call

checkrule_set.description: The lambda passed to assertThrows should contain exactly one statement

checkrule_set.description: Make toString(), hashCode() and equals() final in AutoValue classes, so it is clear to readers that AutoValue is not overriding them

checkrule_set.description: AutoValue recommends using immutable collections

checkrule_set.rule_title: Importing nested classes/static methods/static fields with commonly-used names can make code harder to read, because it may not be clear from the context exactly which type is being referred to. Qualifying the name with that of the containing class can make the code clearer.
checkrule_set.description: Importing nested classes/static methods/static fields with commonly-used names can make code harder to read, because it may not be clear from the context exactly which type is being referred to. Qualifying the name with that of the containing class can make the code clearer.

checkrule_set.description: instanceof used in a way that is equivalent to a null check.

checkrule_set.rule_title: "." is rarely useful as a regex, as it matches any character. To match a literal '.' character, instead write "\.".
checkrule_set.description: "." is rarely useful as a regex, as it matches any character. To match a literal '.' character, instead write "\.".

checkrule_set.description: BigDecimal#equals has surprising behavior: it also compares scale.

checkrule_set.description: valueOf or autoboxing provides better time and space performance

checkrule_set.description: ByteBuffer.array() shouldn't be called unless ByteBuffer.arrayOffset() is used or if the ByteBuffer was initialized using ByteBuffer.wrap() or ByteBuffer.allocate().

checkrule_set.description: Duration can be expressed more clearly with different units

checkrule_set.description: Logging or rethrowing exceptions should usually be preferred to catching and calling printStackTrace

checkrule_set.description: Ignoring exceptions and calling fail() is unnecessary, and makes test output less useful

checkrule_set.rule_title: getNumericValue has unexpected behaviour: it interprets A-Z as base-36 digits with values 10-35, but also supports non-arabic numerals and miscellaneous numeric unicode characters like ㊷; consider using Character.digit or UCharacter.getUnicodeNumericValue instead
checkrule_set.description: getNumericValue has unexpected behaviour: it interprets A-Z as base-36 digits with values 10-35, but also supports non-arabic numerals and miscellaneous numeric unicode characters like ㊷; consider using Character.digit or UCharacter.getUnicodeNumericValue instead

checkrule_set.description: Inner class is non-static but does not reference enclosing class

checkrule_set.description: Class.newInstance() bypasses exception checking; prefer getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance()

checkrule_set.description: Providing Closeable resources makes their lifecycle unclear

checkrule_set.description: Collector.of() should not use state

checkrule_set.description: Class should not implement both `Comparable` and `Comparator`

checkrule_set.description: The result of #compareTo or #compare should only be compared to 0. It is an implementation detail whether a given type returns strictly the values {-1, 0, +1} or others.

checkrule_set.description: Non-trivial compile time constant boolean expressions shouldn't be used.

checkrule_set.description: Warns against suspect looking calls to java.util.Date APIs

checkrule_set.description: DateFormat is not thread-safe, and should not be used as a constant field.

checkrule_set.description: Implicit use of the platform default charset, which can result in differing behaviour between JVM executions or incorrect behavior if the encoding of the data source doesn't match expectations.

checkrule_set.rule_title: Java classes shouldn't use default package
checkrule_set.description: Java classes shouldn't use default package

checkrule_set.rule_title: Applying the @Deprecated annotation to local variables or parameters has no effect
checkrule_set.description: Applying the @Deprecated annotation to local variables or parameters has no effect

checkrule_set.description: Methods should not be directly invoked on mocks. Should this be part of a verify(..) call?

checkrule_set.description: Method expects distinct arguments at some/all positions

checkrule_set.description: Consider annotating methods that always throw with @DoNotCall. Read more at https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/DoNotCall

checkrule_set.description: Don't 'claim' annotations in annotation processors; Processor#process should unconditionally return `false`

checkrule_set.description: AutoValue classes represent pure data classes, so mocking them should not be necessary. Construct a real instance of the class instead.

checkrule_set.rule_title: Double-checked locking on non-volatile fields is unsafe
checkrule_set.description: Double-checked locking on non-volatile fields is unsafe

checkrule_set.rule_title: A block tag (@param, @return, @throws, @deprecated) has an empty description. Block tags without descriptions don't add much value for future readers of the code; consider removing the tag entirely or adding a description.
checkrule_set.description: A block tag (@param, @return, @throws, @deprecated) has an empty description. Block tags without descriptions don't add much value for future readers of the code; consider removing the tag entirely or adding a description.

checkrule_set.rule_title: Caught exceptions should not be ignored
checkrule_set.description: Caught exceptions should not be ignored

checkrule_set.description: @Multibinds is a more efficient and declarative mechanism for ensuring that a set multibinding is present in the graph.

checkrule_set.description: Empty top-level type declarations should be omitted

checkrule_set.description: Prefer instanceof to getClass when implementing Object#equals.

checkrule_set.description: An equality test between objects with incompatible types always returns false

checkrule_set.description: The contract of #equals states that it should return false for incompatible types, while this implementation may throw ClassCastException.

checkrule_set.description: Implementing #equals by just comparing hashCodes is fragile. Hashes collide frequently, and this will lead to false positives in #equals.

checkrule_set.description: This expression evaluates to 0. If this isn't an error, consider expressing it as a literal 0.

checkrule_set.description: Thread pool size will never go beyond corePoolSize if an unbounded queue is used

checkrule_set.description: HTML entities in @code/@literal tags will appear literally in the rendered javadoc.

checkrule_set.description: When only using JUnit Assert's static methods, you should import statically instead of extending.

checkrule_set.description: `T extends Object` is redundant (unless you are using the Checker Framework).

checkrule_set.description: Switch case may fall through

checkrule_set.description: Do not override finalize

checkrule_set.description: If you return or throw from a finally, then values returned or thrown from the try-catch block will be ignored. Consider using try-with-resources instead.

checkrule_set.description: Use parentheses to make the precedence explicit

checkrule_set.description: Floating point literal loses precision

checkrule_set.description: Prefer string formatting using printf placeholders (e.g. %s) instead of string concatenation

checkrule_set.description: Classes extending PreferenceActivity must implement isValidFragment such that it does not unconditionally return true to prevent vulnerability to fragment injection attacks.

checkrule_set.description: Return value of methods returning Future must be checked. Ignoring returned Futures suppresses exceptions thrown from the code that completes the Future.

checkrule_set.description: IdentityHashMap usage shouldn't be intermingled with Map

checkrule_set.description: Getters on AutoValues, AutoBuilders, and Protobuf Messages are side-effect free, so there is no point in calling them if the return value is ignored. While there are no side effects from the getter, the receiver may have side effects.
